headline: Stuffed Peppers with Turkey and Vegetables
description: Stuffed peppers with ground turkey makes an easy and hearty meal. Turkey and a variety of vegetables make a delicious filling for bell peppers.

video.description: Such an easy and delicious recipe for a weeknight meal.
video.name: Stuffed Peppers with Turkey and Vegetables

name: Stuffed Peppers with Turkey and Vegetables
recipeIngredient: 4 green bell peppers, tops removed, seeded

recipeInstructions.text: Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C).
Wrap green bell peppers in aluminum foil, and place in a baking dish. Bake for 15 minutes in the preheated oven. Remove from the oven.

Cook turkey in a skillet over medium heat until evenly brown. Set aside. Heat oil in the skillet, and cook onion, mushrooms, zucchini, red bell pepper, yellow bell pepper, and spinach until tender. Return turkey to the skillet. Mix in tomatoes and tomato paste, and season with Italian seasoning, garlic powder, salt, and pepper. Stuff the green peppers with the skillet mixture.
Return peppers to the oven, and continue cooking for 15 minutes.

review.reviewBody: I stuffed Poblano peppers instead of bell peppers.

As written, four stars.. but.. using the same ingredients in a different order, it turned out amazing! I used 97%fat free turkey and onions, green pepper, zucchini, and spinach as the vegetables. I heavily seasoned the turkey while browning it with crushed garlic, italian seasoning salt and pepper. Let that sit. In another skillet, cook all the veggies in a little olive oil with more garlic and salt and pepper. After 5 min, added fresh diced tomato. Added the turkey in. Cooked it all together for another 10 min. while the green peppers were finishing cooking in the oven. I had large peppers and pre-cooked them wrapped in foil for 30 min. which was the perfect amount of time to chop and cook the filling! I took the peppers out, stuffed them with the filling and threw them back in the oven for 30 min. I halved them and sprinkled white cheddar cheese on each one and microwaved for 30 seconds. They were insanely perfect! It was juicy and flavorful! I will definitely make these again!
We found this really bland and we didn't like the texture. Would not make again
It was ok. Good and hearty for a cold winter night but it really lacked seasoning or flavor.
Loved this recipe!! Will definitely be a keeper

I cooked everything step by step minus the spinach. My daughter and I enjoyed this stuffed pepper. I've made stuffed peppers by boiling peppers , personal choice. I like my peppers super soft. Anyway, the guts was a good stuffing. Actually, I had enough to stuff 5 or 6 peppers depending on pepper size. Thanks for sharing.

This was easy to make and came out tasty. I did chop up the mushrooms since I don’t really like them but didn’t want to change the recipe for the first time making it. I couldn’t tell they were in it and it was good!
Delicious and I added one cup of feta cheese!

This recipe is amazing but I always like to add my own spin and typically use whatever I have in my pantry. Seeing that I had 1/2 cup of medium salsa I added this to the recipe. Instead of canned tomatoes I had some garden tomatoes that I used to cook down so I used that. I also added some chilly pepper flakes and sale and pepper to taste I found this to be a bit bland for my taste.
These were really good; however, I had to add a lot of seasonings to it because a pinch will just not do!

Really good! My kids liked the filling without the peppers. I made it very plain, but could have added Italian spices. My husband added Frank's Red Hot sauce, and said it was very good. Next time, making more stuffing!

Made it and loved it. Did a few things different. Sauteed the onion, garlic (3 cloves) and finely chopped celery. Then I added the meat to brown. Added about 3 teaspoons of the tomato paste, it could've used more. Also, added some cooked rice and topped with sharp shredded cheddar. Overall the design of the original recipe is great and I loved it. I followed everything else to the T. I will make again and add more seasoning.

I sprayed the pan with cooking spray and pre-baked the peppers covered with foil for 40 min. I used two pounds ground beef and was generous with the Italian seasoning and garlic powder. I tossed in a couple teaspoons of dried parsley as this helps blend the flavors. I used two skillets, one for beef and onions, one for other veggies. After stuffing peppers, I poured a can of tomato sauce in the pan before baking for 45-60 minutes. I baked longer because we don’t like crunchy bell pepper. It takes about this long to soften the pepper. Another reviewer suggested using a crock pot, 2 hours on high, then 2 hours on low. I’ll definitely try that next time as I wouldn’t have to precook the peppers or watch the oven! Everyone who eats these absolutely loves them. I also read that you can freeze these and have a ready meal from the oven on a busy night (haven’t tried it yet).
Used Tony Chachere’s Creole on it & garlic. Pan fried the insides til they were almost black on the outside. Amazing taste.

This recipe was good-- will use again. Although I would add a few more minutes to the peppers before adding the meat. 

I also added some pasta sauce in a jar on top of the peppers after they came out the the oven and then broiled for 2-3 minutes. Turned out well-- thank you!
Fantastic

This was absolutely amazing. I used a whole tomato and a can of finely diced tomatoes rather than the paste. I also added two cloves of garlic and cooked with the veggies. I ate it over a bed of rice. SO YUMMY

I called mine unstuffed peppers. I think the process of stuffing the peppers is tiresome. I just dice all the peppers and cook it all as a casserole. And I add a cup of wild rice to the mix just for some extra points. So delicious! I love this!
Great stuffing. Add any veggie you have on hand. You will only improve the taste of bland turkey.

First time making stuffed peppers and always look for healthy ingredients, especially now during virus had to use what I have in the house ! This came out great,but have a lot of stuffing left over for another meal
Will def make again. Made for my dad and he is on low salt so i subbed cheese for nutritional yeast

I am not really sure what I can say. It ( to me) needed more of texture.. I basically felt it was too juicy, it fell out of the peppers and it wasn’t like you wanted to eat the green pepper each bite.
I didn't have zucchini so I omitted this ingredient. Turned out great! That's all we had for dinner and one was very filling. Great when following a low carb diet.

Because of shelter in place I had no fresh mushrooms or zucchini so I used canned mushrooms and blanched green beens, they were great. I wish I would have cooked the peppers longer they were a bit tough.
Yes. I sautéed all of the vegetables for a few minutes before mixing everything together. Also at the last minute I added an eighth of a tablespoon of cheese on top.
I added quite a bit more seasoning just in case, and it turned out great.
This recipe came out perfect and it was delicious.
I added garlic cloves and mozzarella cheese to top it off. Family love it. Thank you for the recipe.
fast and easy. tastes great
SO SO GOOD! Family said this is a definite keeper!
I made this and it was good but I'm going to make it again trying Michelle K version. Hers sounds yummy too!

This was my first time ever making stuffed peppers. I followed the modifications that were in the "most helpful" review left by Michelle K. I took the peppers out a couple of minutes early to add cheese and placed them back in the oven to melt. So good. Saved this recipe to make it gain! :)
I added a little jalepeno to add a little heat to the turkey stuffing for the Bell Pepper. It was very tasty and not bland at all. Great Recipe because you can tweak it to your own tastes.
No changes... Was really good
This was a great tasting, quick & delicious low fat, cholesterol & sodium meal! The only sub I made was fresh garlic to veggies & served w/a wild rice side. So good- thanks to the creator!
I did not put spinach in mine. Also, instead of putting tomato paste in mine, I ate is a roasted garlic pasta sauce! These turned out absolutely amazing :-)
Recipe was really good I added black beans and just used the tops of peppers as colored peppers are too expensive. I did not pre cook the peppers either. Just cooked them a bit longer.
I didn't have mushrooms or canned tomato or tomato paste. I just omitted the mushrooms, and used fresh tomatoes and it was still very tasty!

I made a veggie version using this recipe as the base...turned out great! Stuffing mix: Cook 3 large green onion stalks (save a little for garnish), 2 garlic cloves, half yellow bell pepper, 1/3 zucchini, handful baby spinach, 1 small tomato, 1/2 can blk beans, 1/8th cup cooked quinoa, salt, pepper, Italian seasoning, oregano, dried basil, 2-3 large spoons tomato sauce, and 1/2 cup veggie broth added at the end. Tomato sauce: Mix garlic powder, black pepper, Italian seasoning, 1/2 can tomato sauce. Use 2 whole green bell peppers (cut in halves). Brush olive oil, salt, pepper on bell pepper halves. Pour tomato sauce on bottom of tray. Arrange bell peppers in tray, bake at 400F for 15 min. Then fill mix into bell pepper halves and top each with spoonful of tomato sauce, bake additional 30 min. Optional garnish with cheese and green onions.

This is a great healthier alternative! My family really liked turkey compared to hamburger meat of traditional recipe. I added a little more salt and pepper for my taste but this is a recipe I would recommend!

love this recipe! I actually dont stuff it into peppers. I eat the stuffing plain or with crackers, like a chili. Not the fanciest presentation for it, but it is healthy and easy to make. Have made it several times this way.

If you do stuff the peppers, though, make sure you boil them for a couple minutes before baking. otherwise they are WAY too undercooked.
Me and my family loved it! Very fulfilling and tasty.

As is, this recipe just doesn't work for me. I followed it almost to the letter & the results were not as expected. Baking the peppers yielded them too firm/raw for our needs so I boiled them a bit like I do for beef/rice stuffed peppers. I added much more seasoning than that specified. The final product was dry, dry, dry. Too bad I didn't read the reviews first but I think adding marinara sauce to bake them would help a lot. Not a keeper; I'll stick to the beef & rice version.
This turned out very bland. I added crushed red pepper, salsa, and some sweet chili sauce which improved it significantly.

I made this several times, I chopped up fresh jalapenos instead of mushroom and no stewed tomatoes. Also I made some jasmine rice and added a little to the mixture and topped with cheese in the oven. I do something different each time but this is a good base recipe! Oh and I cut the peppers in half like a boat so the kids can eat them easier.
I left out the zucchini and mushrooms, and added salsa instead of tomato paste/canned tomatoes. Delish. My hubby will even have it again. (That's huge)

This was the 1st time I made stuffed peppers using turkey (usually I use ground lamb). My son, who does not eat red meat, loved these peppers. My hisband and I thought they were okay but rather bland tasting. Also, the pepper stayed crunchy even after baking the recipe’s 30 minutes plus an additional 15 minutes. Next time I think I would mix in some grated cheese or somthing else to give the stuffing more flavor.
Very bland, with little to no flavor. Will require seasoning adjustments in the future.
This is a great recipe! Try using canned tomatoes with green chilis or crushed red peppers to spice it up a bit.

Added red pepper flakes, 1/4 cup Parmesan cheese, garlic clove and used the tops of the peppers instead of adding more peppers. Next time I’ll add some cayenne or hot pepper sauce to spice them even more! Also, didn’t use mushrooms as a DS dislikes them. Served with mashed potatoes, asparagus, and lettuce salad with blueberries and apples. One flavorful dish!
we made it without the meat and everyone loved it!!!
This was delicious! I think next time I would add some parmesan cheese to the mixture and maybe pasta sauce but overall this is a simple and healthy meal that my roommates and I really enjoyed

I was looking for a basic Keto friendly recipe for stuffed peppers and came across this one. Used zucchini and bell peppers from the garden, a volunteer puff ball mushroom from the yard, a hand full of basil from the herb garden, an onion, a sprinkle of chili powder and another of ground cumin (to disguise the ground beef flavor; didn't have any ground turkey). Added some awesome fresh tomato marinara from this website. I stuffed the whole peppers really tight, laid them flat in a pan and poached them. Served with grated cheddar over top. Great recipe!
Should have baked longer and the proportion was enough for 6 peppers! Topped with cheese before serving.

My husband said he prefers ground beef stuffed peppers and I don't need to make this again. I've cooked ground turkey recipes before to reduce saturated fats, but this recipe didn't disguise the taste enough for either one of us.

Mixed in Hot sauce to spice it up. Otherwise a little bland.
we added Italian blend cheese to the top, for the last 5 minutes in oven.
Family loved it!!!

This was a great recipe! I was surprised just how much of a punch of flavor this packed overall. I was liberal in my use of the garlic powder and Italian seasoning but didn’t make any additions in terms of spices. I opted to use a variety of cherry tomatoes that I had on hand instead of the recommended can of diced tomatoes. I also added 3 diced jalapeños (seeds and all) to give it a kick. I topped the peppers with manchego cheese for the last 15 minutes of baking since I enjoy a cheese element to stuff peppers. They turned out great! My wife who wasn’t especially excited about the meal was fully converted after tasting, requesting that this be put on the list of regular meal options. This is a keeper. It is healthy, economical, and easy to prepare.
This was good but will be trying some other stuffed pepper recipes. Great veggies but light on flavor.
I added brown rice, zucchini and onions to turkey. Used same seasoning but used tomato sauce to keep moist. Enjoyed it and will be making again.
This was very tasty and I like using the ground turkey. I left out the mushrooms because I don't like them. Otherwise I stuck to the recipe. I think it would be easy to change up the stuffing.

We have been making this with five red and yellow peppers since I don't care for green. Like others, I just dice the caps for the filling. It makes more than enough to stuff five peppers. The leftover filling is great alone for lunch. My husband doesn't like zucchini and knows it is in this dish and LOVES it. This has become our new favorite dinner and it's healthy!
Pretty bland needs something for sure to this recipe.
No changes delicious !!!
Followed recipe exactly and it was a great tasting, healthy meal!

Finally, my family all agreed that this was a great recipe! I replaced the diced tomatoes and tomato paste with organic marinara sauce. I think it gave it a nice flavor. Regular tomato sauce would work too. I didn't like the thought of using only one tablespoon of the tomato paste. What was I supposed to do with the rest of the can?
This was a great recipe. I added paprika, Chile pepper flakes, oregano, and cheese.
My husband and I loved the stuffed peppers! Made exactly as presented..
I made it as is and added tomato basil pasta sauce instead of paste. It looks so good and tastes great!
A little dry, added herbed tomato sauce to casserole dish before baking and this helped. Would make it again. Good texture and variety of veggies that you could easil modify.
I put a little bit of hot pepper in the mix. Replaced zucchini with leftover grilled cauliflower- it was terrific!

I mixed the turkey meat with hot and sweet Italian sausage. Didn't bother with the spinach, it seemed insignificant in this recipe. It needed a lot more cooking time then the recipe said. Overall it tasted good, just needs more cooking time.
Tastes just like the stuffed peppers my mom made when I was a kid... but without the red meat, rice, and calories. Delicious!!!
A healthy alternative to a regular stuffed pepper. I used red peppers rather than green since my husband and I like the sweeter taste. It was delicious!

I dont pre cook my peppers. I added some meatloaf seasoning and zucchini and squash, mushrooms and couscous. I used tomatoe sauce with a lil splenda brown sugar to cut down on the acidity in the tomato sauce. I baked it for 1 hour . 30 minutes uncovered and 30 minutes covered with aluminum foil. I used red, yellow, and orange Peppers. The green peppers are a little too strong and don't agree with us afterwards. I also added an egg to the mixture and a lil water. so it would be moist. Very good. Hubby really liked it.
delicious.

I liked this dish, made it to specification and came out great. Quick, easy, and little mess. I can see this being easily modified to suit your particluar tastes, different peppers and onions, maybe add some celery. It is also super healthy, low to no saturated fats (coming mostly from the turkey) and a good, healthy mix of veggies.

I liked the heavy vegetable mixture of this recipe, but could tell from the lack of spices that this might be bland so I added cumin to the olive oil before browning the turkey. I also added one clove of raw chopped garlic in addition to the garlic powder. I used quite a bit of dried oregano in this instead of Italian seasonings because I didn't have them. I also added crumbled feta.
This recipe will need some substitutions. I made it as is and it was very bland. I will be searching for another resume and don't believe I will make it again.

Never used ground turkey but after making this I don't think I will ever used ground beef again! This was the most amazing dish I've made. We skipped the spinach because we forgot to buy some other then that had ever thing else on hand and didn't even miss the cheese which I normally topped stuffed peppers with. Outstanding!!!

I blanched the peppers for 10 minutes first and used tri-color peppers instead of green. I added 2 cloves of fresh garlic. I added a 1/2 cup Italian grated cheese in the meat mixture and sprinkled cheese on top before baking. Also added 1/2 can fire roasted tomatoes to the meat mixture and mixed 8 oz. of canned tomato sauce to the rest of the fire roasted tomatoes and spread on the bottom of the casserole before placing the filled peppers on top. It was excellent. Everyone wants me to make this again.

Tasty! Didn't bother wrapping the peppers in foil, and warmed them while the oven was preheating for 15 minutes. Used fresh tomatoes instead of canned, and diced them. I drained the fat from the turkey and cooked the vegetables in the same skillet without needing to add more oil. I used double the tomato paste since I had most of a can. Next time I'll just use ketchup. What ever didn't fit in the peppers I added around them in the casserole dish. Baked for 30 min. Cutting things up ahead of time made things easier too. I'll definitely make this again.
Followed recipe exactly, my husband loved it. Much better than tradition ground beef or turkey & rice stuffed peppers. This is my new stuffed pepper recipe.

I was making this for company, so I made the stuffing ahead of time, and then just cooked, then stuffed the peppers at dinner time It took about 30 min to bake after stuffed, but was much easier and allowed time to visit with my guests.
This was a phenomenal recipe. I didn't change a thing, besides chopping the mushrooms and seasoning the turkey as it cooked to add some flavor. I will keep this one for years!
Amazing! Will be making this again. The only things we did different we used rotel instead of the can of diced tomatoes, and we used fresh garlic instead of powdered garlic.
I'm not a very good cook and I was able to pull this one off! They came out beautifully and tasted great! Thanks for the recipe!

I used a red, green and a yellow pepper cut in half. I also used tomato sauce instead of the diced tomatoes. I boiled the peppers in salted water for 3 minutes before stuffing them. I baked these for 30 minutes covered, then removed them, added cheese and baked for another 15 minutes. Thanks for the recipe:)
I went by the recipe, but added a little crushed red pepper for zing... pretty good
I used orange bell peppers and carved them to look like jack o' lanterns before baking. Other than that I followed the recipe exactly. Delicious! Thank you!

Made the recipe exactly as described except I added red pepper flakes to the turkey and the vegetable mixture during cooking. With 15 min. of pre-baking and 15 min. of actual baking, the green peppers were still really crunchy and I wonder if you shouldn't leave them in for just a few minutes longer. I will probably make it again since it was a relatively cheap, easy, and healthy meal. Next time I'll add more spices and probably some cheese.
It was a bit bland for my and the hubby's taste, so next time I may try changing the spices out for something spicier.

We really liked the flavor. It's a good use for turkey, and it's low carb, but the lack of a binder made the dish kind of messy on the plate. The first cut made the contents scatter. I did not add the zucchini, and honestly, I can't see how I could have gotten all the stuffing ingredients into only 4 peppers, and mine were not small peppers. I used a can of diced fire-roasted tomatoes, and it was a good choice. I could see this with more sauce over zucchini noodles or spaghetti squash, rather than inside a pepper. Again, we did enjoy the flavor--a lot of our favorites were in the dish, and we hardly noticed we were eating ground turkey. Thanks!
My husband loved this recipe. I did not add zucchini but I did add riced cauliflower and a little bit of ketchup. It came out great. I would highly recommend it!

It was very easy and delicious my picky eater even liked it but I did change the seasoning I used no salt I used flavor God seasoning And olive oil to cook the veggies added flavor God to both veggies and turkey delicious
I made it with ground lamb and topped with cheddar cheese. It was wonderful!

Very tasty. Made with 1/2 turkey sausage & 1/2 ground turkey. Cut the peppers in half and microwaved them for a short time to precook before filling them. Added some cayenne pepper to veg/meat filling. And surrounded the filled 1/2 peppers with herb enhanced tomato sauce and topped with grated Parmesan cheese. Covered them when baking to hold moisture in.

A very versatile recipe that I make weekly. As other users suggested I add red pepper flakes, basil, oregano. I add all spices to meat when cooking. I use zucchini and red peppers Bc that is what I like. I make it as a taco filling and use leftovers on a salad with feta. Great light calorie meal

I cant speak for the exact recipe but the idea gets 5 stars. We added taco seasoning to the turkey, and used mushrooms, celery, spinach and chopped peppers for the veggies. Covered the empty peppers in foil and put in the oven according to the recipe, but not sure how long and it didnt seem to make a huge difference. Piled the filling into the peppers alternating scoops and cheese, finishing with cheese on top. Put them back in the oven uncovered for about 15 min or less, just until the cheese was bubbly. They were very tasty! I also added some garlic and onion powder to the veg while it cooked. My husband put hot sauce on it, like everything, and loved them. We ate the leftover mixture in a tortilla and still good! Thanks!

I added crushed red pepper and one spicy Italian sausage since we like our food with some zing. Next time I will cut them in half and stuff each half. We had a lot of stuffing left over. It was a delicious meal!

item.name: Stuffed Peppers with Turkey and Vegetables
